summary: Saint Peter, also known as Peter the Apostle, was one of Jesus' twelve closest followers and a leader in the early Christian Church. He is mentioned in all four gospels and the book of Acts in the Bible. Catholic tradition says he was the first pope, or bishop of Rome, and also led the Church in Antioch. According to tradition, Peter was crucified in Rome. He is considered a major saint by many Christian churches. In the New Testament, he is often called Simon Peter or Cephas. Peter and his brother Andrew were fishermen. Some books in the Bible, like 1st and 2nd Peter, are traditionally thought to be written by him, but this is debated by scholars.
title: Saint Peter
